data.title: Remove the dead ActorGroupProxy trait
data.body: It didn't receive any updates in a long time, so I don't think there's a reason to keep it.

data.title: Fix support powers not being enabled by cheats
data.body: Just start a game as allied faction and build an airfield.

data.title: FallsToEarth needs more control over spinning acceleration
data.body:
When trying to implement Kirov bomber, its husk needs to spin and fall down to earth.
Current implementation only looks good for helicopters, as it makes the husk spin faster and faster and doesn't fit slow falling blimps.

data.title: WithAnimations Issue (Traits)

WithMoveAnimation is not working when unit has WithHarvestAnimation trait.
and would be nice if WithHarvestAnimation affects WithInfantryBody.

data.body:
Turrets following units into the fog of war and lock on the unit till a new target is choosen.

data.title: Spy disguise removed if the spy is targeted
data.body:
If you target your own spy as target for a disguise he is disguised as a spy this is logical and (right) logically but in game it is a pain to disguise your spies. This is also a bit random as sometimes some of the spies will keep there disguises. In the pictures below you can see the targeted spy losing his disguise and the spy to his left gets his disguise the others do nothing.

data.title: Disable ToolTip while using support powers
data.body:
When you use support powers you want to see what you are doing and what units you are doing it on.
Here is a picture of me about to chronoshift some units (the image also show how difficult is is to see on this background).
![openra-2017-02-26t095721465z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/23338806/94d76abc-fc14-11e6-92e7-6e7bb2b2def3.png)

data.title: Hotkeys don't work properly [RA]
data.body:
Game Commands
-Here there needs to be a working shortcut for cycling between "Infantry Tab", "Vehicle Tab", "Aircraft Tab" & "Naval Tab" the tabs that does not require a placement (the production tabs). Some might also want to have the structure tabs on this cycling shortcut.

Unit Commands
-Deploy key does not work with Shift (action queues) but pressing your mouse on the unit does.
-Shift (action queues) does not work with some units (Chrono Tank).
-Queuing of actions followed by entering a transport vehicle will cancel the queues & go strait to the transport vehicle this also happens with capture command for the engi. 

Main
-Why is placing structures & using support powers left mouse button when that is usually used for cancel & all the other commands are right mouse button, It is not intuitive.

data.title: Server Ports Are Not Forwarded
data.body:
Can't host a game.
I keep getting the messages:
Server ports are not forwarded.
Game has not been advertised online.

I don't get what the deal is. I'm clearly online. I see other games. I can join other games.
But on rare occasions, I can host.

At first, I thought starting the game as admin would fix it and it seemed to be the case but, it turns out that didn't do anything.

I even tried opening up the command prompt to find out what my router's port numbers were. I guess that fix was an illusion too because the issue is back again.

I've never seen this happen with other games.
Here's a screenshot of the error if you guys really need it. Disregard the server name. I got salty after 30 tries.
![cant](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/23334450/bf741c14-fb6c-11e6-8edb-2c9addd53b6c.png)

I have a D-link
Model: DIR-868LA1

data.title: Hide cloak/decloak sounds under shroud
data.body: As of now in TD, when a stealth tank is on the playing field everyone else in the game knows as well and if they are smart they can even try to count how many this person is acquiring. On top of this it also tells the enemy that you have a Temple of Nod. My suggestion is to only allow the sound to be heard when in the players active view.

data.title: game mechanic that allows TD players to come back from no money in a team game
data.body: As of now, when a players refinery is destroyed and they lack the money to construct one they are effectively out of game because TD has no mechanic that allows team members to transfer money. Red Alert has the supply trucks and my suggestion is to implement the same, if not then a similar, thing for TD. This is open to other suggestions.

data.title: Hide the starport animation from highlights and when not playing.
data.body: Some more fixes to go along with #12841.

data.title: Player-rating and name-lock based on ip
data.body:
idea is to give everyone the possibility to rate any player (ingame/lobby) but just for their own eyes 

further more , if i could lock a name to a Ip ... this could tackle smurfing which often leads to unbalanced teams  

this ip-ratings and/or name-locks then go into a .log file independent from any release/playtest

or maybe use a command to add a note on a specific players tooltip (ip in reality) ... that show up on the ping-indicators tooltip

any thoughts ? could this be a temporary solution ? better wait for a proper account-system ? could this happen more likely than accounts ?

data.title: RA and TD Pathfinding Needs Work
data.body:
The RA and TD pathfinding for vehicles needs work. 
If you send a vehicle with a slower vehicle (like a Mammoth) or a group of infantry to a location and the faster vehicles are behind them, they will literally _hump_ the back of those infantry or slow unit until they reach their destination.

The same applies for setting vehicles to defend Ore Trucks and Harvesters (or any other slow moving unit). Rather than swerving around them to get to their destination, they will tailgate them until the entire force becomes a liability. This can especially be a problem when you're trying to reinforce a contested area of a map or an overwhelmed truck (Harv or Ore).

The weird thing is, the ONLY time that vehicles do try to take detours is when there's a bridge or shallow crossing however, this also has faults. That's one of the only times you don't want the to take a detour. Whenever they try to detour, they would opt to find the most "Harold and Kumar Goes to White Castle"-esque alternate path they can find rather than using the extra shallow crossing or bridge that sits beside the occupied bridge; meaning they would trek to the opposite end of the map to find another opening if you don't stop them.

This issue can also sometimes be seen with VTOLs (helis or choppers in both games) as well.
If you have a group of maybe 5+ VTOLs, the one furthest back in the hovering cluster won't bother to weave around to get a clear shot of a target but, would instead accept its at the back of the line and not attack at all. 
For friendly aircraft, there should be some compromise where they can "pass through" each other; going with the idea that they are simply elevated high that another unit so they can all hit their assigned targets (like in the old games).

An even bigger issue though, is if a vehicle (like a tank) or an infantry is being hit by an enemy outside of their range (even by one tile), they will take the beatings until you tell them to go after the target or until you hear that the unit was lost.

"Neutral" Civilians also don't make any effort to dodge vehicles and vehicles don't bother to detour around them either. I don't even think running over units gives XP either so there's no real benefit to it either.

On a positive note, I would say that the infantry does try to actively avoid getting run over by vehicles (sometimes). 

I'm not trying to sound negative, don't get me wrong. I LOVE OpenRA but, I often find myself playing skirmishes than  multiplayer because I was one of those guys that didn't know online CnC was a thing in the 90s so by the time I find out, I missed the boat (EA ruined everything). 
OpenRA is pretty good but, I would love to see it work towards its full potential by fixing issues that weren't even in the original games (some of them at least). In fact, I can't even play Tiberium Wars or old RA or TD anymore because there's so many improvements in OpenRA.

The only reason I'm being so critical with this stuff is because I (and most of us) know we probably won't ever get another real C&C game and OpenRA is the closest thing we'll ever get to that. 

With mushy crap outta the way, thanks and keep on doing what you're doing.
As I've stated in other posts, I don't have the slightest idea on how to code or program things, I just know how to make maps prettier than they should be.

data.title: "Real tough guy" difficulty doesn't fit the UI

Using this nicely requires changing the UI or changing it to something like Extreme or Very Hard.

data.title: Release 20161019: Performance issue Red Alert
data.body:
When playing single player there was a performance drop in the game. Which isn't unusual on large maps with many AI's, however when all the ships where destroyed and only two small minor AI's were still existing, the game remained as slow.

Only once the second to last player was destroyed (bottom right player), the game was perfectly fast again. (I have a brand new i7, 16GB ram computer new from this January, so on other computers the replay might be very slow)

I submit this as there is a chance it's something specific and this replay might isolate the problem.

MOD: Red Alert
Type: Single player
Release: 20161019

In attachment:
- Perf log
- Debug log
- Replay file
- Map file

Download:
[Perf.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/800087/Perf.zip)

Screenshot from performance offending player (dark blue):
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6690499/23315816/25c76aca-fac8-11e6-8880-f90251d4c79f.png)
Lighter blue killed all the ore trucks, etc and halted attacking him for the remaining of the game. Only once I killed dark blue, the slow down was gone.

I'm not sure if it's something that's easily fixed or if it contributes to any new knowledge. 
Feel free to close this issue when the problem is already know.

Thanks for looking into this and keep up the great work!

data.title: Allies 06a: Make the AI only build submarines if the player has a shipyard
data.body: Fixes a part of #12806.

data.title: Fix welding lights of Dune 2000 structures
data.body:
This PR should fix #9641 

The only structure which is a bit off is the heavy factory of the mercenaries. All the other factions have 10 frames, mercenaries use 8. This is also the odd part of the heavy factory lights. In total they have 47 frames, but effective I only use 38 of them. Still it doesn't seem that there is anything missing.

For reviewing I would suggest either to check if there is something "off" during the animation or to compare it to the original game, what is quite time consuming but easier if you record your screen and replay it afterwards.

data.title: RA Balance batch 2
data.body:
Following #12739, I would like to suggest two more additional changes:

**War Factory**
Cost decreased from $2000 to $1600, ~10s build time reduction  

The 40s MCV build time was intended to discourage the abuse of mass MCVs. However, this change also delays the early game phase by 8 seconds. In order to minimize the effect of time with regards to the balance of future playtests, I propose decreasing the cost and build time of the War Factory in order to normalize the timing of the crucial second MCV. This change will have a minimal effect on subsequent MCVs since those MCVs are not dependent on the timing of of the War Factory or Service Depot. 

This change would also accelerate the early economy and scouting relative to the normalized MCV timing, so players will have additional resources and tools to deal with base pushes. In addition, the lower cost will give players more opportunities to deviate away from mass infantry in late-game situations, as well as expand the types of early game skirmishes that could occur. 

**MCV**
Speed decreased from 85 to 75

In addition to the $2500, 40s MCV, the community has also been experimenting with a change to the MCV speed. The suggested change is mostly qualitative and intended to allow players a few more seconds to react to aggressive MCV movements. This change also helps normalize the build time of the second MCV due to the previously mentioned $1650 War Factory. The 11% decrease in travel time increases the time needed to get to the natural, single ore mine on Sidestep by roughly 3-5 seconds, depending on the location of the War Factory. 

It is in my opinion that the aforementioned changes, in combination with the MCV cost changes, will provide a more stable platform to perform future balance changes on. These changes have been tested for approximately 1 month, and during that time, it has received a majority positive feedback from both casual and competitive players. 

Also, this is my first pull request...I apologize if I have missed something or done something wrong

data.title: (All games) Repair cursor does not allow L-click drag select
data.body:
In the original C&C (not sure about D2K / Red Alert) you were able to left-click and drag select with the repair option selected with the repair cursor.  This is not present in this engine.  I tested it with D2K and C&C and Red Alert.  Instead, you need to right click to set the cursor back to default, then left-click drag.  It would be nice to have this left-click drag with the repair cursor implemented since it was present in the original versions.

Version: 20161019

data.title: Restore sell value of TD refinery.
data.body:
The convention for all buildings in our main mods (and I believe all buildings in all C&C games) is that selling a full health structure will give you back half of its value in cash, and (up to) the rest in infantry.

Balancing is certainly important, and I appreciate @AoAGeneral's work on this, but breaking this convention for the TD refinery sets a precident that doesn't sit well with me.  This brings it back to the standard behaviour ($1000 of the $1500 sticker price is for the harvester, which is not refunded).

data.title: Make ConditionExpression ! return false for negative numbers.
data.body: This brings it in line with standard C/C++ behaviour.

data.title: [RA] Added Huey Gunship as replacer for Hind
data.body:
Related to:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/12810
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/12197#issuecomment-281485039
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/12831

![gunship-cameo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5789302/23277652/5fca9c24-fa5a-11e6-9681-c5dcd4f0209c.PNG)

![ingame](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5789302/23276284/797e9a94-fa55-11e6-93b0-ca07586703ea.png)

![huey-idle-hover-circel-preview](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5789302/23276244/53657be8-fa55-11e6-9429-d411941ae4a8.gif)

![huey-gunfire-circel-preview](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5789302/23276251/575e116a-fa55-11e6-90a9-42b3412f7899.gif)

- Completely custom shp matching the standard of other Westwood's vehicles.
- Complete replacement of Hind rules
- Better than token edits to the Hind, even without it's stub wings, the Hind is still a Hind. 
- Small version of rotor used. Images feature the large one.

data.title: Units Disregard Owned Mines
data.body: I don't recall this being an issue in the original game (especially with Ore Trucks) but, owned-units completely disregard placed mines and even park on top of them (detonating them) if they can't move to the exact location they were given (near but not on the mine).

data.title: Added ShpTS, TmpTD to d2k|SpriteFormats in mod.yaml
data.body:
This is the intersection of SpriteFormats in ra/mod.yaml and cnc/mod.yaml added to d2k/mod.yaml.
It homogenizes used  SpriteFormats among mods and allows use of shp(TS) in d2k, which is important for people working with SHP Builder 3.37.

data.title: Vanishing Attack Dogs
data.body:
So I was playing the campaign for RA and I realized there's a bit of a game breaking glitch where if a group of Attack Dogs charge for one person, one or two of them will despawn and get marked as a "Unit Lost" when nothing even hits them.

This is most noticeable on the mission, Covert Cleanup.
I lost 2 of 3 attack dogs trying to kill one civilian.
Honestly, the best way to describe it would be two/three of the dogs merged into each other to become one dog. That's literally what appeared to have happened.

data.title: D2K - Add Harkonnen Mission 2b
[RA] Rename and alter the 'Hind' to 'Cobra'
data.body:
following https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/12197#issuecomment-281485039

![cobra 0000](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/23234802/93167bfa-f953-11e6-9258-fbaedc2823ec.png)

![hind-to-cobra6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/23277920/f8f036e8-fa0f-11e6-8b6c-fd93b6ba1147.gif)


As for the hind.shp:

- Cut off the Hind's "wings", turned dual chainguns into single chaingun (added turret).
- Grey-scaled and slightly merged the blue tinted bubble canopies.

Also altered the chaingun min. range from 0c768 to 1c768 due to a new weapons offset. Balance and performance wise I don't see any potential hazard. As far as I'm concerned the Hind name in the .shp and .yaml ought to just stay given the original unit being the foundation for the Cobra.


![alter3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/23235857/5153a89c-f957-11e6-8d6c-54c5a8b73ca2.png)

video footage: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F9uSI2N6ZSs
